name: Surimi, Spinach, and Roasted Red Pepper Quiche
author: JennyJenn
summary: This creamy and colorful quiche will stand out at your next brunch party.  Also works great as a main course for dinner.   It is very easy to make and tastes very gourmet.
ingredients: 1 (9 inch) pastry for a 9 inch single crust pie
8 ounces surimi (imitation crabmeat), cut into bite-sized pieces
3 tablespoons roasted red peppers, drained and chopped
½ (10 ounce) package frozen chopped spinach, thawed and drained
directions: Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C)
Press the pie crust into a 9 inch glass pie plate, and press fingers along the upper edge to decorate
Bake in preheated oven until the crust is very lightly browned, about 12 minutes
Meanwhile, whisk together the eggs, cream, garlic powder, pepper, salt, and hot pepper sauce in a bowl until well blended
Fold in the surimi, green onions, roasted peppers, spinach, Cheddar cheese, and Parmesan cheese
Return to the oven, and bake 20 minutes
Turn the oven off, and leave the quiche in the oven until slightly firm, 20 to 30 minutes
